name: attenuation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of making something less or weaker: The airport has undertaken a noise attenuation programme. The drug plays a role in the attenuation of inflammation.
the process or fact of making something longer and thinner: the graceful attenuation of a Modigliani sculpture See
attenuate
More examplesFewer examplesFree trade should lead to the attenuation rather than the aggravation of inequalities.In copper-wire cables, signal attenuation increases as a transmission signal travels longer distances. Attenuation of the stress involved in surgery improves postoperative outcomes.
